Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2012 02:38PM kmangus wrote: Thank you Chrissy.  I had a friend check out my breast and I think I may i have overacted.  Friend says that breast looks the same and maybe a bit better.  I'm going to wait unless things change until my March 7 appt.  Thanks again.  My husband died 3 years ago at 43 from melanoma.  This was the worst thing that I could imagine.  Now this.  I'm mostly okay.  I do appreciate your kind words.  What treatment are you enduring?

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2012 05:52PM kmangus wrote: Thank you Chrissy.  Mostly I keep it together but sometimes I have to rely on you guys.  It helps me.   If I was nervous, I wouldn't be having this conversation.   I'm worried about all sorts of things:  could I have inflamatory  b/c (sp) , looking after my recently widowed mom ( who is freaking out),  friends who don't wan't to hear about anything negative that I may say; and friends who now want to get in touch after hearing that I may not be well.  k
Posts.Title: Advice kmangus chrissyb

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2012 03:34PM kmangus wrote: Thank you Chrissy.  You give me hope which I think I need.  I love the pic of you  and child.  I live in Toronto and have friends living in Perth.  Fingers crossed and blessings to you and yours.  I   look upon what happened to my husband as the worst thing I have endured so anything else is not so bad.  Good luck to you and stay in touch.  i'm off to sleep  k
Posts.Title: Advice kmangus chrissyb

Posts.Content: kmangus wrote: I am 50 years with breast cancer recurrence after 15 years.  I had a lumpectomy, radiation and CMF.  In May it was determined I had a recurrence at scar site.  As I was about to have a mastectomy for re current problem surgery was halted as it was noted that I had spread to skin of breast.  After many tests it is also determined there is a spread to mediastinal nodes.  I have been taking femara for short time about a month.  It seems like my external spread on the offending breast is continuing.  I have been told I am stage 4.  What should I next except.  I  have not appts until March.  Should I let doc know that there may be new external developments or wait to see if the drug kicks in. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Advice kmangus chrissyb

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2012 05:17PM kmangus wrote: Thank you all for your kind replies.  I am not sure but it after reading my online chart it seems I have 4 or 5 medisitnal lymph nodes involved.  I have an appointment with my oncologist next week.  So far so good but I'm becoming more frightened.  Maybe looking at stuff on the internet is not so good.  I have the usual symptoms from the drug (sweating, hot flashes) but very mild from chemo and radio 15 years ago.  Good luck to you and I will update after my appt. next week.  k
